meanings.definition: To make something unique or specific to a particular person or thing.
meanings.sent1: She likes to individualize her gifts by adding personal touches.
meanings.sent2: Teachers often individualize their teaching methods to help each student learn effectively.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to individualize each dish by adding a special ingredient.
meanings.sent4: His artistic style is so unique, it truly individualizes him from other painters.
meanings.sent5: The tailor's attention to detail really individualizes his custom-made suits.

meanings.definition: To distinguish or separate something from others.
meanings.sent1: The new logo helps individualize our brand from competitors.
meanings.sent2: Using different colors can help individualize each section of the report.
meanings.sent3: The unique packaging design individualizes our product on the shelves.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting style helps individualize her notes from others in the class.
meanings.sent5: Adding personal photos can individualize your workspace and make it your own.

meanings.definition: To personalize or tailor something to suit an individual.
meanings.sent1: The company offers to individualize the product with custom engraving.
meanings.sent2: She always individualizes her workout routine to fit her own fitness goals.
meanings.sent3: The artist individualized the portrait by capturing the subject's unique smile.
meanings.sent4: The designer can individualize the dress to perfectly fit your measurements.
meanings.sent5: He individualizes each coaching session to address the specific needs of his clients.
